page.title: 06Old Cotswold Roads
page.content: Condicote Lane, also known as the Roman Road Ryknild Street, runs NW to SE in a direct line from Condicote to the Slaughters. At Nosehill Farm which is at Huntsmans Quarry we were told that the road there had been used by drovers taking cattle from Wales to London markets. Beside this road is a stone trough reputed to be Roman where the cattle were watered. At Kineton Hill there ia a good firm track which used to run directly to Stow and went away NW to join an old saltway towards Belas Knap long barrow and Sudeley Castle both at Winchcombe, once a Saxon capital.
